conclusion: The working principle of the electromagnetic railgun involves a conductive projectile moving between two parallel rails, propelled by Lorentz force.
Xiao Ming purchased a railgun model with specific parameters: rail length 0.5 m, rail spacing 0.02 m, projectile mass 0.02 kg, rail current 10 A, magnetic field strength 1 T.
The image shows two parallel rails with a projectile between them, indicating the direction of current and magnetic field.
Calculate Lorentz force on the projectile: F = I d B = 10 A × 0.02 m × 1 T = 0.2 N.
Determine acceleration of the projectile: a = F / m = 0.2 N / 0.02 kg = 10 m/s².
Calculate exit speed after traveling the rail: v = √(2 a L) = √(2 × 10 m/s² × 0.5 m) = √10 ≈ 3.16 m/s.
Calculate instantaneous power at the muzzle: P = F v = 0.2 N × 3.16 m/s ≈ 0.63 W.
The railgun delivers about 0.6 W of power to the projectile at the instant it leaves the 0.5-m rails.
